posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Hello and welcome, Vhalyr!

Before we get going, which campaigns are you wanting to play? Are you talking about the Original (Plague) Campaign followed by something else, or Shadows of Undrentide followed by Hordes of the Underdark then something else, or any of the numerous modules or persistent worlds?

Your timing is perfect, btw. Empyre 65 recently provided me with a couple of WM builds because I'd always struggled with them before. One has Devastating Critical, the other not (again, it depends where you want to play). The first can be found in the General Discussion sub-forum on page 20 (iirc) of the New Full Epic Series thread (post #200, dated 6 April this year) and is a Fighter 14/ Bard 10/ WM 16. The second is in the Modules sub-forum on page 28 of the Aielund Saga thread (post #280, dated 26 August this year) and is a Fighter 10/ Bard 8/ WM 22.

Melee classes are excellent fun (much better than those spellcasting loons imo - others may take issue, but they're just wrong), and you shouldn't be missing out on stuff wherever you play.

Anyway, have a look at those two, and let us know where you'll be playing.

Cheers!

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
As far as the official campaigns are concerned, the OC will get you to around level 17/8 and SoU/HotU will end at about level 28. If you want continuity, you really shouldn't do the OC/SoU/HotU, because the middle one will be incredibly dull as you'll be so overpowered for it - it's designed for level 1 to about level 15. So if you want to get all the way to 40 you'll have to go into some other modules. Here are a few options I've enjoyed...

The OC followed by Aribeth's Redemption then Sands of Fate.
The OC followed by Mines of Twin Summit.
SoU followed by HotU (there's a bridge module called the Nether Scrolls, which I haven't played but Empyre recommends) then Sands of Fate.
Then there's the awesome Aielund Saga, which takes you from level 1 up to around level 36/7.

Anyway, I'll leave it with you.
Cheers

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content:
The OC goes from level 1 through level 17 (or so). SoU goes from level 1 through level 14 (or so). HotU is supposed to follow SoU, and goes to level 27 (or so). You can follow the OC with the Mines of Twin Summit series to get all the way to level 40, and follow HotU with the Sands of Fate series to get to level 40. And then, the awesome Aielund Saga takes you from level 1 to level 36 (or so).

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Vhalyr wrote: Ok, so i am off to playing Aielund now :D

What is a suggested class/build for it? I read somewhere that rangers have custom dialogue lines?
Hoorah!

One of the great things about Aielund is that (assuming you have a decent build) any class can excel. Though, to be fair, I couldn't attest to those odd spell-chucking types. Empyre gives 3 splendid - and splendidly different options - but many others will work just fine (I know Mick's soloed it as an Assassin, while I do like me some DwD and/or CoT. And Dex builds are as worthwhile as Str ones). It helps hugely that the AI of NPCs is so much better, and you get to travel with two at a time - do have chats with them as you go along.

It's not that Rangers have custom dialogue lines as such, just that both Rangers and Bards get an extra skill point or two per level (it's all on page 13 of the thread). Of course, some dialogues will differ according to class, alignment, stats, feats and skills, but that's only to be expected. All part of the enjoyment!

Cheers

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content: Good builds all of them Empyre, just a minor change I would do, In your "Aielund Draco Twinblade" if you start with wisdom(8)/dexterity(15) you will only need 6 great strength's to reach 40. You can then move armour skin at 36th level and get it before Aielund ends. Since you do not need the 19th & 20th fighter level anymore you can substitute them for two more bard levels, thus getting an overall stronger song as well.

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content:
With 14 DEX, you can get a maximum of 2 AC from DEX. Since there is no armor that allows exactly 2 DEX AC, heavy armor (which allows 1 AC from DEX) will be best for you.

It probably has already been mentioned in this thread, but when you finish the OC, you can take this character into the Mines of Twin Summit series to go the rest of the way to level 40. This build can kick some serious butt there.

I see that you have chosen to focus on greatswords. You will miss out on AC from some nice shields in the future, but you will do serious damage with that 2-handed weapon. I usually go for sword-and-board myself.

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content: I meant MTS after the OC. SoU starts at level 1, and HotU follows SoU, and then the Sands of Fate series can follow HotU and bring you the rest of the way to level 40. You can optionally play a bridge module like The Nether Scrolls between SoU and HotU. I and others here can help you pick or even make a build for that when the time comes.
